articles.title: Another plot twist in Scottish title race for the ages
articles.summary: BBC Scotland examines the lie of the land in the Scottish Premiership title race.

articles.title: Late arrival & incredible comeback - Burnley deepen Palace woes
articles.summary: The Clarets' remarkable first-half fightback keeps alive their slim hopes of Premier League survival, but where does it leave Crystal Palace?

articles.title: How 'terrific' Wirtz shone for Liverpool
articles.summary: Match of the Day pundit Danny Murphy says Florian Wirtz was "pulling the strings" for Liverpool in their 1-0 against Sunderland.

articles.title: Should Foden have been sent off against Fulham?
articles.summary: Match of the Day pundit Danny Murphy believes Manchester City's Phil Foden was "lucky" not to have been sent off for a tackle on Fulham's Calvin Bassey.

articles.title: Frank dismissal needed as Spurs in danger of relegation - Shearer
articles.summary: Match of the Day pundit Alan Shearer believes Tottenham had no choice but to sack manager Thomas Frank as the club are currently in a relegation battle.

articles.title: Who are NI's potential Nations League opponents?
articles.summary: Before Thursday's Uefa Nations League draw in Brussels, BBC Sport NI takes a look at Northern Ireland's potential opponents, including the Republic of Ireland and Scotland.

articles.title: Papers: Havertz set for spell on sidelines with injury
articles.summary: The top stories and transfer rumours from Thursday's newspapers...

articles.title: 'If it's an isolated incident, it's a second yellow' | Was Baleba lucky to escape sending off?
articles.summary: Jay Bothroyd feels Brighton's Carlos Baleba was lucky to escape a sending off against Aston Villa for his challenge on Amadou Onana after he was already on a yellow card early in the match.

articles.title: 'They want to make a quick appointment' | Forest identify Pereira as Dyche replacement
articles.summary: Anton Toloui says Nottingham Forest want to make a quick appointment following Sean Dyche's sacking and have identified former Wolves manager, Vitor Pereira as the potential successor.

articles.title: Man City 'breathing down Arsenal's neck' as title 'belief' grows
articles.summary: Pep Guardiola vowed his Manchester City side would "breathe down the neck of Arsenal" as they aim to hunt down the Premier League leaders in this fascinating title race.

articles.title: Frank's downfall: Inside his struggle to get players and fans onboard
articles.summary: Thomas Frank has been sacked as Tottenham manager after just eight months in charge. BBC Sport's Sami Mokbel takes a closer look at his tenure.

articles.title: Will 40-point mark be needed for Premier League survival?
articles.summary: Will the 40-point mark - or thereabouts - be needed to guarantee survival this term, with an in-form West Ham attempting to chase down the sides above them?

articles.title: Van Dijk scores as Liverpool beat Sunderland to close top-four gap
articles.summary: Virgil van Dijk's header gives Liverpool a 1-0 victory over Sunderland, as Arne Slot's side become the first away team to win at the Stadium of Light in the Premier League this season.

articles.title: Haaland ends open-play goal drought as Man City beat Fulham
articles.summary: Erling Haaland scores his first goal from open play in the Premier League in nine games, as Manchester City soundly defeat Fulham 3-0 to move three points behind league leaders Arsenal.

articles.title: Burnley score three quickfire goals to stun Palace in comeback win
articles.summary: Burnley score three goals in seven minutes as Scott Parker's side come from 2-0 down to beat Crystal Palace 3-2 at Selhurst Park in the Premier League.

highlights.title: Premier League highlights this week - Week Highlights

articles.title: Lexington Jet chases hat-trick at Lingfield
articles.summary: Lingfield opens its gates for All-Weather Championships action today, with all seven races live on Sky Sports Racing.

articles.title: Clubs to vote on expanding Championship play-offs
articles.summary: EFL clubs will vote on expanding play-offs in the Championship from four to six teams at a meeting next month.

articles.title: Birmingham owner Wagner recovering from stroke
articles.summary: Birmingham City's American chairman Tom Wagner has suffered a stroke, the Championship club have confirmed.

articles.title: Football Daily
articles.summary: Aaron Paul, Jobi McAnuff & Millwall's Massimo Luongo to react to Leicester's collapse.

highlights.title: Championship highlights this week - Week Highlights

articles.title: Are Hearts developing the habit of champions?
articles.summary: Does Heart of Midlothian's late derby winner against Hibernian suggest they are developing the habit of champions as they go six points clear at the top of the Scottish Premiership?

highlights.title: League One highlights this week - Week Highlights

articles.title: Grimsby on cusp of play-off spots after beating Accrington
articles.summary: Grimsby brought themselves back to within a point of the Sky Bet League Two play-offs with a 1-0 win over Accrington at Blundell Park.

articles.title: Holman stars as Swindon go second with win over Newport
articles.summary: Substitute Fletcher Holman's stunning cameo put Swindon into second in League Two as he fired in the opener and set up the own-goal clincher in a 2-0 win over Newport.

highlights.title: League Two highlights this week - Week Highlights

articles.title: Tuchel set to sign two-year extension with England
articles.summary: Thomas Tuchel is set to extend his contract as England manager through to Euro 2028.

articles.title: Saints’ young star Robertson on silverware hopes and World Cup ambitions
articles.summary: In his short career so far, reigning Young Player of the Year Harry Robertson has set Super League alight and those around him are expecting that to go up a notch in 2026 for St Helens.

articles.title: England to play New Zealand and Costa Rica in final World Cup warm-ups
articles.summary: England will complete their World Cup preparations with matches against New Zealand and Costa Rica in Florida in June, before travelling to their base in Kansas City.
